data.title: ASCII Compression
data.solution:
message = input()
answer = ""
position = 0
while position <= len(message)-1:
    if 65 <= int(message[position:position+2]) <= 99:
        answer += chr(int(message[position:position+2]))
        position += 2
    elif 100 <= int(message[position:position+3]) <= 122:
        answer += chr(int(message[position:position+3]))
        position += 3
    else:
        answer += message[position]
        position += 1
print(answer)
data.statement:
<<Story:>>
You work in a company that deals with numbers - a <<lot>> of numbers. Your boss has been talking about how the company expends a lot of money in buying servers to handle the numbers. One day you get a brilliant idea to compress the numbers - here's how it works:

<<Method:>>
The basic idea behind the compression is to scan, from left to right, the substrings in the given number, and whenever a substring is found to be the ASCII number of an English letter, replace the substring with the letter. Other digits are kept unchanged. Below is an example:

Take a number, for example {{973478}}. Here, {{97}} and {{78}} are ASCII numbers for {{a}} and {{N}} respectively. So, replacing the numbers with the respective letters, you get {{a34N}}.
Here, {{73}} is also valid, but {{97}} is taken since it occurs first.

But, for a string such as {{1041122}}, {{h1z}} is not a proper compression. (This can happen if the string is not scanned from left to right.)

Your task is to build a program to compress any [[number]] in the above method and return the compressed [[output]].
(The number is given as a string of digits for easier management.)
data.constraints: The input [[number]] is between {{3}} and {{15}} digits. (both inclusive)
data.stubGenerator:
read message:string(15)
write The compressed number

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Story:
You work in a company that deals with numbers - a lot of numbers. Your boss has been talking about how the company expends a lot of money in buying servers to handle the numbers. One day you get a brilliant idea to compress the numbers - here's how it works:

Method:
The basic idea behind the compression is to scan, from left to right, the substrings in the given number, and whenever a substring is found to be the ASCII number of an English letter, replace the substring with the letter. Other digits are kept unchanged. Below is an example:

Take a number, for example 973478. Here, 97 and 78 are ASCII numbers for a and N respectively. So, replacing the numbers with the respective letters, you get a34N.
Here, 73 is also valid, but 97 is taken since it occurs first.

But, for a string such as 1041122, h1z is not a proper compression. (This can happen if the string is not scanned from left to right.)

Your task is to build a program to compress any number in the above method and return the compressed output.
(The number is given as a string of digits for easier management.)
Input
Line 1: The input number
Output
Line 1: The compressed output
Constraints
The input number is between 3 and 15 digits. (both inclusive)
Example
Input
973478
Output
a34N
